act: GUYANA FREE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Incorporation of Executive Council.
type.context: GUYANA FREE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH ACT under Incorporation of Executive Council. 3. (1) There is hereby established the Executive Council of the Guyana Free Protestant Episcopal Church which shall be a body corporate.  (2) Subject to this Act, the President, Vice-President, Treasurer, Secretary and three other persons appointed by the President, and their successors in office shall be members of the Council.

description.description: There is hereby established the Executive Council of the Guyana Free Protestant Episcopal Church which shall be a body corporate.

act: GUYANA FREE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Death or absence from Guyana of a member of Council, etc.
type.context: GUYANA FREE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH ACT under Death or absence from Guyana of a member of Council, etc. 4. During the absence from Guyana of a member of the Council or the refusal or inability of a member to act as such, or the subsistence of a vacancy in the membership of the Council occasioned by the death of a member or otherwise, the surviving or remaining members may in the name of the Council exercise all or any of the powers conferred on the Council by this Act.
type.description: During the absence from Guyana of a member of the Council or the refusal or inability of a member to act as such, or the subsistence of a vacancy in the membership of the Council occasioned by the death of a member or otherwise, the surviving or remaining members may in the name of the Council exercise all or any of the powers conferred on the Council by this Act.

act: GUYANA FREE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Vesting of property in the Council.
type.context: GUYANA FREE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH ACT under Vesting of property in the Council. 5. (1) All property, movable and immovable, which immediately before the commencement of the Act was vested in or beneficially entitled to by the Church or its Seminary, is by virtue of this Act and without further assurance, vested in the Council.  (2) Where by virtue of this Act, immovable property is vested in the Council, the property shall for all purposes be treated as if it were passed to the Council by LAWS OF GUYANA Guyana Free Protestant Episcopal Church Cap. 43:01 5  L.R.O. 1/2012          Vesting of property bequeathed to the Church or to a member of Council.         Property vested in the Council to be held in trust for the Church. act: GUYANA FREE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Vesting of property bequeathed
type.context: GUYANA FREE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH ACT under Vesting of property bequeathed 6. All property movable or immovable bequeathed by will or otherwise given to the Church or to a member of Council, whether before or after the commencement of this Act, to and for the use and benefit of the Church, shall be held by, and is hereby vested in, and shall be deemed to be the property of the Council.

act: GUYANA FREE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Property vested in the Council to be held in trust for the Church.
type.context: GUYANA FREE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH ACT under Property vested in the Council to be held in trust for the Church. 7. Property vested in the Council by virtue of this Act or acquired by the Council after the commencement of this Act shall be held by Council in trust for the use and benefit of the Church.
type.description: Property vested in the Council by virtue of this Act or acquired by the Council after the commencement of this Act shall be held by Council in trust for the use and benefit of the Church.

act: GUYANA FREE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH ACT

type.name: section
type.title: Evidence of acts.
type.context: GUYANA FREE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH ACT under Evidence of acts. 8. (1) A person signing as President, Vice-President, Secretary, Treasurer or member of the Council shall be so taken to be until the contrary is proved.  (2) A statement that a person named therein is a member of the Council or that a document is a true copy of a document or of an extract from a document or entry in the books or records of the Council purporting to be signed by the President and at least one other member of the Council shall be admissible as prima facie evidence of the fact, original entry, matter or transaction.

type.name: section
type.title: Execution of documents.
type.context: GUYANA FREE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH ACT under Execution of documents. 9. (1) A document required to be formally executed by or on behalf of the Council shall be deemed sufficiently executed if signed by the President and at least one other member of the Council.  (2) Any other document shall be deemed to be duly executed if signed by a person authorised by the Council so to sign and such person shall be deemed to be the person LAWS OF GUYANA 6 Cap. 43:01 Guyana Free Protestant Episcopal Church  L.R.O. 1/2012       Service of process.       designated in such document and to be so authorised until the contrary is proved.
